research-team.name: Dr. Jessie Barrot
research-team.testimonial: HealthPH transforms social media data into actionable insights for proactive disease surveillance and a healthier tomorrow.

research-team.name: Dr. Mideth Abisado
research-team.testimonial: Our mission with HealthPH is to weave advanced technology into the fabric of our public health system, ensuring the well-being of every Filipino and preserving the legacy of our diverse languages.

research-team.name: Avonn Nova
research-team.position: College Dean, College of Computing and Information Technologies
research-team.testimonial: E-governance and social media integration enable us to tap into real-time data streams, providing a dynamic and responsive approach to managing public health crises.

research-team.name: Ramon Rodriguez
research-team.testimonial: The integration of machine learning with social media data analysis has the potential to transform public health surveillance by providing more granular and immediate insights into disease spread and public sentiment.

research-team.name: Joseph Marvin Imperial
research-team.testimonial: I envision HealthPH to be one of the first initiatives for open research where artifacts, findings, code, data, and resources are openly available to the public and adjacent research communities for consumption, dissemination, and advancement of scientific progress in Health x AI.

research-team.name: Bernie Fabito
research-team.testimonial: HealthPH in the near future will leverage the way we listen and pinpoint emerging diseases through social media.

research-team.name: Emeliza Yabut
research-team.testimonial: The utilization of social media for disease surveillance in the Philippines bridges gaps in conventional data collection, offering a comprehensive view of public health dynamics.

research-team.name: Marilen Pacis
research-team.testimonial: The use of social media data in disease surveillance empowers the Philippines to enhance public health monitoring and response efforts, especially in remote or underserved areas.

research-team.name: Dr. Maria Luisa Bautista
research-team.testimonial: Social media analytics can complement traditional surveillance methods, providing a more comperehensive picture of disease activity.

research-team.name: Mico Magtira
research-team.testimonial: HealthPH is a game-changer for suspected symptoms surveillance, providing real-time analysis and multilingual support that helps us respond swiftly to potential health threats.

research-team.name: Aiken Joaquin Gunay
research-team.testimonial: There is not a single surveillance system that can monitor more than 2 symptoms unlike HealthPH that monitors 4 suspected symptoms in all 17 administrative regions and provides analytical data on each of them. LGU members will deeply benefit utlizing the system to protect Filipinos.

research-team.name: John Carlo Jimenez
research-team.testimonial: HealthPH combines technology and public health surveillance into a useful tool that will aid health professionals across the country to make informed decisions regarding possible and arising respiratory diseases.

research-team.name: Jean Malolos
research-team.testimonial: The HealthPH website offers a compelling visual representation of social media surveillance efforts in the Philippines.

research-team.name: Mathias Villacarlos
research-team.testimonial: HealthPH leverages the power of social media to revolutionize disease surveillance and public health monitoring. By harnessing advanced algorithms and real-time data analysis, HealthPH provides timely and accurate insights into disease trends and outbreaks. This innovative approach enhances the ability of health authorities to respond swiftly and effectively, ultimately improving public health outcomes and ensuring the well-being of communities across the nation.

dost-pchrd.name: Engr. Timothy Jen Roxas
dost-pchrd.position: Project Manager, Digital and Frontier Technologies for Health, DOST-PCHRD
dost-pchrd.testimonial: HealthPH is the perfect introduction of state-of-the-art techniques of disease surveillance in the Philippines, made possible through artificial intelligence. The monitoring of social media posts in four (4) different languages makes it possible for a fast, reliable, and nationwide system for the early detection of respiratory diseases to be made.

dost-pchrd.name: Ms. Louise Sky Olaguer
dost-pchrd.position: Program Head, Digital and Frontier Technologies for Health DOST-PCHRD
dost-pchrd.testimonial: Through the commendable efforts of the HealthPH team, the creation of an inclusive and innovative disease monitoring tool for respiratory diseases is no longer a dream. By utlizing informal data sources such as social media, the early detection of respiratory diseases can now reach the farthest of the Philippine islands. Through data analytics, the government and LGUs can also provide timely intervention to prevent disease outbreaks and bring about a safer, healthier Philippines.
